entry.title: Brycent on Web3 Games and the Problem with 'NFT Value'
entry.summary: XSET gamer and content creator Brycent tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the problem with gaming NFTs—and what needs to happen instead in the next generation of Web3 games.

entry.title: How a Yogurt Shop Started Mark Otero's Video Game Career
entry.summary: Azra Games CEO Mark Otero tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his career developing eight RPG games and being acquired by Electronic Arts before getting into Web3.

entry.title: Blockchain Games Will Shed Their 'Well-Deserved' Bad Reputation In 2023, Says Solana Games Lead
entry.summary: Solana Foundation's General Manager of Games Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his predictions for Web3 gaming in 2023.

entry.title: NFL Rivals NFT Mobile Game Launches, Plans Move to Polkadot
entry.summary: Mythical Games' officially-licensed NFL Rivals is now available on iOS and Android, with the studio plotting a Polkadot migration ahead.

entry.title: Bitcoin Retakes $29,000 Amid First Republic Bank Uncertainty
entry.summary: Bitcoin bounced back after shares in First Republic Bank tumbled, reigniting the cryptocurrency's value proposition as a “safe haven” asset.

entry.title: Bitcoin Whitepaper Removed from Apple Computers Following Belated Discovery
entry.summary: Hidden in operating system files since 2018, the document will not be part of the next update.

entry.title: MNTGE Debuts Token-Enabled Vintage Jeans With ‘Fruits & Veggies’ Drop
entry.summary: Designer Sean Wotherspoon upcycled vintage Levi’s with a fresh, embroidered finish—and an NFC chip tied to a MNTGE NFT pass.

entry.title: Arthur Hayes: If You're Still in Traditional Banking System, Be Prepared to 'Take an L'
entry.summary: "If we want crypto to be another financial system, people need to really understand what we're trying to replace, or improve upon," he said.

entry.title: We're Going to Stop Calling it Web3 Gaming, Says Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer
entry.summary: Magic Eden Chief Gaming Officer Chris Akhavan talks Web3 adoption and Web3's reputation problem with Decrypt's Kate Irwin. Also, he shares his stance on the word "NFT."

entry.title: FTX Finalizes $50 Million Sale of LedgerX Crypto Derivatives Exchange
entry.summary: The sale to M7 Holdings comes amid continuing efforts to untangle FTX's Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

entry.title: OpenAI Boosts Privacy With Ability to Delete Chat History
entry.summary: A ChatGPT business offering that provides stronger data management options is also in the works.

entry.title: Apple's 30% Tax Mandate on iOS Is Illegal, Judge Affirms—And That Could Be Good for Crypto, NFTs
entry.summary: The appeals court largely upheld Apple’s victory against Epic Games, but found it cannot forbid app makers from circumventing its 30% cut.

entry.title: ARK Invest and 21Shares Aren’t Backing Down From Bitcoin ETF Bet
entry.summary: The two have filed a third Bitcoin exchange traded fund application—despite previous rejections from the SEC.

entry.title: FTX Acquired a Video Game That Sam Bankman-Fried Loved. Now It's Shutting Down
entry.summary: “Thanks for all the memories,” the Storybook Brawl team wrote on Twitter, saying it had no way forward amid the crypto exchange’s bankruptcy.

entry.title: Meta Profits Set to Drop as Zuckerberg Pivots to AI, Analysts Say
entry.summary: The tech giant is set to report its first-quarter earnings tomorrow.

entry.title: Former OpenSea Exec Fights ‘Insider Trading’ Label as DOJ Trial Begins
entry.summary: "The defense disputes that Mr. Chastain’s conduct can be described as 'insider trading,'" a defense attorney wrote in the court filing.

entry.title: The Mysterious Disappearance of ChaosGPT— The Evil AI That Wants to Destroy Humanity
entry.summary: ChaosGPT, the AI designed to destroy the world, has been quiet—too quiet. Is it dead, is it paused, or is it just acting in the dark as it said it would?

entry.title: Ava Labs' Ed Chang on the Future of Web3 Gaming
entry.summary: At the Game Developer's Conference in San Francisco, Ava Labs' Head of Gaming Ed Chang spoke with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Ava Labs' approach to Web3 gaming, building games on Avalanche, and gave his thoughts on what the coming months and years will look like for the ecosystem.

entry.title: Binance US Walks Away From Voyager Deal, Cites Regulatory Uncertainty
entry.summary: A judge approved the deal, buy regulators raised issues with the purchase.

entry.title: Cybersecurity Firm Forta Anticipated $200M Euler Finance Hack Using AI
entry.summary: With machine learning, Forta Network saw the Euler attack coming—but only by a few minutes.

entry.title: Inside the Lucrative New Business of Selling AI Prompts
entry.summary: A new cottage industry has sprung up around experts and marketplaces helping users craft queries for AI services for a fee.

entry.title: DJs Steve Aoki, 3LAU Reveal First Single as ‘Punx’ NFT Duo
entry.summary: As Punx, the musicians will share a percentage of music rights from their new song "Concentrate" on Royal with 99 NFT collectors.

entry.title: A 'Subset' of Creditors Walked Away From Genesis Deal: DCG
entry.summary: A group of Genesis Capital creditors have withdrawn from their previous agreement with the bankrupt crypto lender.

entry.title: Arbitrum Airdrops $120 Million in ARB to DAOs
entry.summary: Ethereum scaling solution Arbitrum has begun distributing 113 million ARB tokens to DAOs within its ecosystem.

entry.title: Google Adds Web3 Features to Cloud Offerings
entry.summary: Web3 startups can now get specialized services when they build using Google Cloud.

entry.title: This Generative Digital Fashion Startup Is Skipping the Metaverse—For Now
entry.summary: A generative digital fashion platform launched its first collection, which cannot be worn in the metaverse.

entry.title: ‘Avengers’ Director Predicts AI-Generated Movies Within Two Years
entry.summary: ‘Avengers: Endgame’ director Joe Russo sat down with the CCO of Epic Games to talk artificial intelligence in the entertainment industry.

entry.title: ‘Napoleon Dynamite’ Star Jon Heder to Lead NFT Animated Series ‘Space Junk’
entry.summary: Toonstar’s animated web series "Space Junk," which hails from “Workaholics” co-creator Dominic Russo, lets NFT holders vote and participate.

entry.title: Coinbase CEO Backs 'Stand with Crypto' NFT Campaign
entry.summary: America’s largest crypto exchange has launched a new campaign aimed at pushing the U.S. authorities to finally deliver “sensible crypto policy.”

entry.title: Terra Co-Founder Daniel Shin Indicted in South Korea: Report
entry.summary: Local prosecutors announced charges against ten people linked to Terra, including Terraform Labs co-founder Daniel Shin.

entry.title: Fine Art Photographers Join Forces to Launch NFTs to Battle Climate Change
entry.summary: Yann Arthus-Bertrand, Namsa Leuba, and Nicolas Henry will be selling their work on Web3 photography platform Rhapsody.

entry.title: OFAC Sanctions Target Supporters of North Korean-Linked Lazarus Group
entry.summary: The people sanctioned were used by hackers to "conduct transactions on their behalf to avoid detection" said the Treasury Department.

entry.title: DAOs Could Get Official Standing Under Proposed California Law
entry.summary: A Golden State assemblymember has drafted a bill to provide a legal framework to include DAOs among acceptable business entities.

entry.title: Coinbase Asks Court to Force SEC to Clarify Crypto Regulations
entry.summary: The cryptocurrency exchange filed the petition along with a long list of questions last July.

entry.title: Visa Stepping Up Crypto Ambitions With Web3 Developer Job Ad
entry.summary: The global payments firm is hiring an engineer familiar with Ethereum.

entry.title: ‘Honeypot Bitch’: How Mad Lads Tricked Bots Into Spending $250K on Fake NFTs
entry.summary: The hyped Solana NFT drop overcame extortion threats and DDOS attacks with a fake mint, Coral CEO Armani Ferrante told Decrypt.

entry.title: Binance Adds AI-Powered ‘Sensei’ Chatbot to Its Crypto Academy
entry.summary: Powered by ChatGPT, Binance hopes the bot will boost crypto education engagement.

entry.title: Satoshi-Era Bitcoin Whale Moves $11 Million After Sleeping for 12 Years
entry.summary: Yet another long-term HODLer has decided to move their secret stash.

entry.title: Do Kwon Seeks To Dismiss SEC Charges as South Korea Rules LUNA Is Not a Security
entry.summary: The Terraform Labs founder also called Terra’s failed stablecoin a currency and said he wasn't given sufficient warning about alleged SEC violations.

entry.title: 'Dying in this game is different than other games,' Says Lead Mirandus Dev
entry.summary: Gala Games Cofounder and Mirandus Developer Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Mirandus' hardcore fantasy world and its high stakes.

entry.title: Bitcoin's Six-Week Hot Streak Ends as Institutions Turn to Ethereum
entry.summary: "Regionally, the profit-taking was almost solely from North America, which saw outflows totaling $54 million," CoinShares writes in its new report.

entry.title: Digital Euro Will Have ‘Maximum Level of Privacy’—But Not as Much as Cash: ECB Board Member
entry.summary: ECB board member Fabio Panetta stopped short of saying that the digital euro would have ‘the same level of privacy’ as cash.

entry.title: What is EtherMail? The ‘Read-to-Earn’ Web3 Email Service
entry.summary: EtherMail aims to deliver “anonymous and encrypted wallet-to-wallet communication” to power Web3 and upend the advertising market.

entry.title: gm: Arthur Hayes Says Crypto Failures Are A Sign of The System Cleansing Itself
entry.summary: Arthur Hayes says the speed at which projects like Terra grow and implode is a feature of the crypto industry, not a bug. He founded crypto exchange Bitmex in 2014 and then became the original crypto bad boy. In 2021 the DOJ charged him in with violating the U.S. Bank Secrecy Act for not implementing an anti-money laundering program at Bitmex. He plead guilty and was sentenced to two years probation and six months of home detention. In fact, he was still sporting an ankle bracelet on a recent cover of New York Magazine. Now he's living in Singapore, offering up his views on the crypto industry with long form, meme-filled essays, and still thinks the crypto industry will save investors from what he calls a broken banking system. "I don't care if you're capitalist or you're a communist. Everybody put on a lot of debt. We've passed the point where that debt is becoming useful," he said. "And therefore everyone is going to take an L unless they get some crypto or some gold—some hard asset that's outside of the traditional banking system."

entry.title: Brycent on Meeting Gary Vaynerchuk through Web3 Gaming
entry.summary: XSET gamer and content creator Brycent tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about how entrepreneur and VeeFriends creator Gary Vaynerchuk first reached out to him.

entry.title: gm: Anthony Scaramucci Is More Bullish on Bitcoin Than Ever
entry.summary: Anthony Scaramucci of hedge fund SkyBridge Capital got burned by Sam Bankman-Fried: he co-hosted SALT conferences with FTX and sold a 30% stake in SkyBridge to FTX Ventures. And yet "The Mooch" tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott "I'm more bullish now than I have ever been" on crypto as an investment case. He discusses his frustration with SBF, how wrong he thinks politicians like Elizabeth Warren and Gary Gensler are about crypto and how to regulate it, what he sees happening next with adoption, and talks about Trump. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer: The Problem With SEC's Howey Test Isn't Its Age
entry.summary: Coinbase Chief Legal Officer Paul Grewal discussed the "Howey Test," which the SEC uses as its yard stick for whether a crypto asset should be regulated as a security, and told Decrypt's Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts the issue with it isn't that it's old (the case is from 1946) but how it's being applied to modern technology. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Decentralized Pictures Plots Its Next Web3 Grant for Filmmakers
entry.summary: Leo Matchett from Web3 film funding platform Decentralized Pictures tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about DCP's just announced iPhone Filmmaking Initiative, which will support aspiring filmmakers who create a short film on their iPhones, and will be determined via DCP's crypto-native on-chain voting system.

entry.title: Web3 YouTuber CryptoStache: Gaming Will Be the Catalyst That Takes NFTs Mainstream
entry.summary: Web3 gaming YouTuber CryptoStache talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA about why Web3 gaming will bring NFTs mainstream, the partnerships that prove it's already happening, how gamers will change their tune on NFTs, and how the terminology is likely to change.

entry.title: Fordefi Aims to Dramatically Simplify the Institutional Crypto Wallet
entry.summary: Steve H., VP of sales from Fordefi, which raised $18 million in funding last year, tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson at Outer Edge LA how Fordefi uses multi-party computation to make signing transactions on an institutional crypto wallet much simpler—no seed phrase needed.

entry.title: gm: Canadian Bitcoin Miner Hut 8 Is Heading West
entry.summary: Toronto-based Bitcoin mining company Hut 8 recently announced a merger with U.S. Bitcoin Corp that will take it into Texas, Nebraska, and New York. Hut 8 CEO Jaime Leverton joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott to talk expanding into the U.S., dealing with regulatory pushback post-FTX, why Texas is such a hotspot, and where she'd like to expand globally down the road (the climates may surprise you). Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: gm: Kevin Owocki Wants to Regenerate DeFi
entry.summary: Move over, DeFi—ReFi is coming? Gitcoin founder Kevin Owocki has stepped away from DeFi grant-giving machine Gitcoin as it fully decentralizes and is now focused on regenerative finance (huh?) and ReFi incubator Supermodular. He aims to "regenerate the regenerators." He explained it all to Dan Roberts and Liam Kelly, and also talks DAO structure, crypto factions, NFT use cases, his book "Greenpilled," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Why Aurory's Head of Production Left Ubisoft for Web3
entry.summary: Aurory executive producer and head of production Jonathan Campeau tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about how the first-generation of Web3 games came out of DeFi and are now evolving.

entry.title: 'We Don't Really Do the Corporate Thing Very Well' Says Jason Brink on Gala Games Approach
entry.summary: With roughly 50 video games in its pipeline, Gala Games is all-in on Web3. Gala's President of Blockchain Jason Brink told Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC about the studio's ethos and weighs in on the different approaches to Web3 gaming.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
